availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel P. Hager (Johnson County, Kentucky, postmaster)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, merchant and postmaster. Kentucky native. Son of Daniel Hager and Violet Hager. Married to Anjalina R. Brown Hager in Johnson County on November 21, 1860. Father of Willie C. Hager and Harry Hager. Student and farmer in Johnson County in 1850. Postmaster of Paintsville, Kentucky, from June 3, 1856, to October 23 1857. Bar keeper in Johnson County in 1860. Merchant in Johnson County in 1863. Postmaster of Paintsville in December 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 112B-113A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 152.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, Paintsville, p. 182A.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971. Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Johnson County, Kentucky, Volume 14, pp. 650-51, p. 476 of 573 of microfilm.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Johnson County Marriages, 1843-1875, Film #001912950, pp. 72-3, p. 32 of 239 of microfilm.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 9th Congressional District, Johnson County, Vol. 1 of 3, October 1863, p. 175, p. 178 of 212 of microfilm), (Accessed via ancestry.com on August 13, 2020).
